content:
Here is the cleaned up text:

Drag a Radio element from the Build panel onto the canvas.

In the Properties panel, give the element a name in the Name field. Enter a label visible to the user in Field Label.

Select how to display the radio buttons in Display Mode. Options include:

* Horizontal (default)
* Vertical
* Image
* Segmented (Newport only)

If you select Image, configure additional properties:

* Width
* Height
* Image Count In Row
* Enable Caption

Select where the list of options come from in Option Source:

* Manual
* Custom: Enter the Apex class and method that returns the options.
* SObject: Retrieves the picklist values from the Salesforce object and field.

If you select Manual or Image, for each option click + Add New Option and enter the Value and visible Label. You can also upload an image to display.

Check Use as Default to make the option selected by default, and Auto Advance to advance the user to the next step when they click this option.

To retrieve options based on another value, configure Controlling Field Type and follow these steps:

* To define the source of the controlling field, select Custom or SObject.
* In Controlling Field Source, enter an Apex class.
* In Controlling Field Element, enter an OmniScript element name.
title: OmniScripts Radio Element Configuration
